member.name: T:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.CreateSystemInstanceRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateSystemInstance operation. Creates a system instance.
This action validates the system instance, prepares the deployment-related resources. For Greengrass deployments, it updates the Greengrass group that is specified by the greengrassGroupName parameter. It also adds a file to the S3 bucket specified by the s3BucketName parameter. You need to call DeploySystemInstance after running this action.
For Greengrass deployments, since this action modifies and adds resources to a Greengrass group and an S3 bucket on the caller's behalf, the calling identity must have write permissions to both the specified Greengrass group and S3 bucket. Otherwise, the call will fail with an authorization error.
For cloud deployments, this action requires a flowActionsRoleArn value. This is an IAM role that has permissions to access AWS services, such as AWS Lambda and AWS IoT, that the flow uses when it executes.
If the definition document doesn't specify a version of the user's namespace, the latest version will be used by default.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.CreateSystemInstanceRequest.Definition
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Definition.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.CreateSystemInstanceRequest.FlowActionsRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FlowActionsRoleArn.
The ARN of the IAM role that AWS IoT Things Graph will assume when it executes the flow. This role must have read and write access to AWS Lambda and AWS IoT and any other AWS services that the flow uses when it executes. This value is required if the value of the target parameter is CLOUD.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.CreateSystemInstanceRequest.GreengrassGroupName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GreengrassGroupName.
The name of the Greengrass group where the system instance will be deployed. This value is required if the value of the target parameter is GREENGRASS.

The name of the Amazon Simple Storage Service bucket that will be used to store and deploy the system instance's resource file. This value is required if the value of the target parameter is GREENGRASS.

member.name: T:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.DeploySystemInstanceRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DeploySystemInstance operation. Greengrass and Cloud Deployments
Deploys the system instance to the target specified in CreateSystemInstance.
Greengrass Deployments
If the system or any workflows and entities have been updated before this action is called, then the deployment will create a new Amazon Simple Storage Service resource file and then deploy it.
Since this action creates a Greengrass deployment on the caller's behalf, the calling identity must have write permissions to the specified Greengrass group. Otherwise, the call will fail with an authorization error.
For information about the artifacts that get added to your Greengrass core device when you use this API, see AWS IoT Things Graph and AWS IoT Greengrass.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.DeploySystemInstanceRequest.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The ID of the system instance. This value is returned by the CreateSystemInstance action.
The ID should be in the following format.
urn:tdm:REGION/ACCOUNT ID/default:deployment:DEPLOYMENTNAME

member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetSystemTemplateRevisions operation. Gets revisions made to the specified system template. Only the previous 100 revisions are stored. member.name: P:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.SearchEntitiesRequest.Filters
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Filters.
Optional filter to apply to the search. Valid filters are NAME NAMESPACE, SEMANTIC_TYPE_PATH and REFERENCED_ENTITY_ID. REFERENCED_ENTITY_ID filters on entities that are used by the entity in the result set. For example, you can filter on the ID of a property that is used in a state.
Multiple filters function as OR criteria in the query. Multiple values passed inside the filter function as AND criteria.

member.summary:

The maximum number of results to return in the response.

member.name: T:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.SearchThingsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the SearchThings operation. Searches for things associated with the specified entity. You can search by both device and device model.
For example, if two different devices, camera1 and camera2, implement the camera device model, the user can associate thing1 to camera1 and thing2 to camera2. SearchThings(camera2) will return only thing2, but SearchThings(camera) will return both thing1 and thing2.
This action searches for exact matches and doesn't perform partial text matching.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.SearchThingsRequest.EntityId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EntityId.
The ID of the entity to which the things are associated.
The IDs should be in the following format.
urn:tdm:REGION/ACCOUNT ID/default:device:DEVICENAME

member.name: T:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.UpdateFlowTemplateRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the UpdateFlowTemplate operation. Updates the specified workflow. All deployed systems and system instances that use the workflow will see the changes in the flow when it is redeployed. If you don't want this behavior, copy the workflow (creating a new workflow with a different ID), and update the copy. The workflow can contain only entities in the specified namespace.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.UpdateFlowTemplateRequest.CompatibleNamespaceVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CompatibleNamespaceVersion.
The version of the user's namespace.
If no value is specified, the latest version is used by default. Use the GetFlowTemplateRevisions if you want to find earlier revisions of the flow to update.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.UpdateFlowTemplateRequest.Definition
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Definition.
The DefinitionDocument that contains the updated workflow definition.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.UpdateFlowTemplateRequest.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The ID of the workflow to be updated.
The ID should be in the following format.
urn:tdm:REGION/ACCOUNT ID/default:workflow:WORKFLOWNAME

member.name: T:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.UpdateFlowTemplateResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateFlowTemplate operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.UpdateFlowTemplateResponse.Summary
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Summary.
An object containing summary information about the updated workflow.

member.name: T:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.UpdateSystemTemplateRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the UpdateSystemTemplate operation. Updates the specified system. You don't need to run this action after updating a workflow. Any deployment that uses the system will see the changes in the system when it is redeployed.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.UpdateSystemTemplateRequest.CompatibleNamespaceVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CompatibleNamespaceVersion.
The version of the user's namespace. Defaults to the latest version of the user's namespace.
If no value is specified, the latest version is used by default.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.UpdateSystemTemplateRequest.Definition
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Definition.
The DefinitionDocument that contains the updated system definition.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.UpdateSystemTemplateRequest.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The ID of the system to be updated.
The ID should be in the following format.
urn:tdm:REGION/ACCOUNT ID/default:system:SYSTEMNAME

member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateSystemTemplate operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.UploadEntityDefinitionsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UploadEntityDefinitions operation. Asynchronously uploads one or more entity definitions to the user's namespace. The document parameter is required if syncWithPublicNamespace and deleteExistingEntites are false. If the syncWithPublicNamespace parameter is set to true, the user's namespace will synchronize with the latest version of the public namespace. If deprecateExistingEntities is set to true, all entities in the latest version will be deleted before the new DefinitionDocument is uploaded.
When a user uploads entity definitions for the first time, the service creates a new namespace for the user. The new namespace tracks the public namespace. Currently users can have only one namespace. The namespace version increments whenever a user uploads entity definitions that are backwards-incompatible and whenever a user sets the syncWithPublicNamespace parameter or the deprecateExistingEntities parameter to true.
The IDs for all of the entities should be in URN format. Each entity must be in the user's namespace. Users can't create entities in the public namespace, but entity definitions can refer to entities in the public namespace.
Valid entities are Device, DeviceModel, Service, Capability, State, Action, Event, Property, Mapping, Enum.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.UploadEntityDefinitionsRequest.DeprecateExistingEntities
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeprecateExistingEntities.
A Boolean that specifies whether to deprecate all entities in the latest version before uploading the new DefinitionDocument. If set to true, the upload will create a new namespace version.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.UploadEntityDefinitionsRequest.Document
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Document.
The DefinitionDocument that defines the updated entities.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.UploadEntityDefinitionsRequest.SyncWithPublicNamespace
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SyncWithPublicNamespace.
A Boolean that specifies whether to synchronize with the latest version of the public namespace. If set to true, the upload will create a new namespace version.

member.name: T:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.UploadEntityDefinitionsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UploadEntityDefinitions operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.UploadEntityDefinitionsResponse.UploadId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UploadId.
The ID that specifies the upload action. You can use this to track the status of the upload.

member.name: T:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.AmazonIoTThingsGraphClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing IoTThingsGraph
AWS IoT Things Graph
AWS IoT Things Graph provides an integrated set of tools that enable developers to connect devices and services that use different standards, such as units of measure and communication protocols. AWS IoT Things Graph makes it possible to build IoT applications with little to no code by connecting devices and services and defining how they interact at an abstract level.
For more information about how AWS IoT Things Graph works, see the User Guide.

Example App.config with credentials set.

member.name: M:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.AmazonIoTThingsGraphClient.AssociateEntityToThing(Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.AssociateEntityToThingRequest)
member.summary:
Associates a device with a concrete thing that is in the user's registry.
A thing can be associated with only one device at a time. If you associate a thing with a new device id, its previous association will be removed.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the AssociateEntityToThing service method.
member.returns: The response from the AssociateEntityToThing service method, as returned by IoTThingsGraph.

member.name: M:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.AmazonIoTThingsGraphClient.CreateFlowTemplate(Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.CreateFlowTemplateRequest)
member.summary: Creates a workflow template. Workflows can be created only in the user's namespace. (The public namespace contains only entities.) The workflow can contain only entities in the specified namespace. The workflow is validated against the entities in the latest version of the user's namespace unless another namespace version is specified in the request.

member.returns: The response from the CreateFlowTemplate service method, as returned by IoTThingsGraph.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateFlowTemplate Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.AmazonIoTThingsGraphClient.CreateSystemInstance(Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.CreateSystemInstanceRequest)
member.summary:
Creates a system instance.
This action validates the system instance, prepares the deployment-related resources. For Greengrass deployments, it updates the Greengrass group that is specified by the greengrassGroupName parameter. It also adds a file to the S3 bucket specified by the s3BucketName parameter. You need to call DeploySystemInstance after running this action.
For Greengrass deployments, since this action modifies and adds resources to a Greengrass group and an S3 bucket on the caller's behalf, the calling identity must have write permissions to both the specified Greengrass group and S3 bucket. Otherwise, the call will fail with an authorization error.
For cloud deployments, this action requires a flowActionsRoleArn value. This is an IAM role that has permissions to access AWS services, such as AWS Lambda and AWS IoT, that the flow uses when it executes.
If the definition document doesn't specify a version of the user's namespace, the latest version will be used by default.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateSystemInstance service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateSystemInstance service method, as returned by IoTThingsGraph.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateSystemInstance Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.AmazonIoTThingsGraphClient.CreateSystemInstanceAsync(Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.CreateSystemInstanceRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Creates a system instance.
This action validates the system instance, prepares the deployment-related resources. For Greengrass deployments, it updates the Greengrass group that is specified by the greengrassGroupName parameter. It also adds a file to the S3 bucket specified by the s3BucketName parameter. You need to call DeploySystemInstance after running this action.
For Greengrass deployments, since this action modifies and adds resources to a Greengrass group and an S3 bucket on the caller's behalf, the calling identity must have write permissions to both the specified Greengrass group and S3 bucket. Otherwise, the call will fail with an authorization error.
For cloud deployments, this action requires a flowActionsRoleArn value. This is an IAM role that has permissions to access AWS services, such as AWS Lambda and AWS IoT, that the flow uses when it executes.
If the definition document doesn't specify a version of the user's namespace, the latest version will be used by default.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateSystemInstance service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the CreateSystemInstance service method, as returned by IoTThingsGraph.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateSystemInstance Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.AmazonIoTThingsGraphClient.DeploySystemInstance(Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.DeploySystemInstanceRequest)

summary.para: Deploys the system instance to the target specified in CreateSystemInstance.
If the system or any workflows and entities have been updated before this action is called, then the deployment will create a new Amazon Simple Storage Service resource file and then deploy it.

Since this action creates a Greengrass deployment on the caller's behalf, the calling identity must have write permissions to the specified Greengrass group. Otherwise, the call will fail with an authorization error.
For information about the artifacts that get added to your Greengrass core device when you use this API, see AWS IoT Things Graph and AWS IoT Greengrass.

member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DeploySystemInstance service method.
member.returns: The response from the DeploySystemInstance service method, as returned by IoTThingsGraph.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for DeploySystemInstance Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.AmazonIoTThingsGraphClient.SearchThings(Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.SearchThingsRequest)
member.summary:
Searches for things associated with the specified entity. You can search by both device and device model.
For example, if two different devices, camera1 and camera2, implement the camera device model, the user can associate thing1 to camera1 and thing2 to camera2. SearchThings(camera2) will return only thing2, but SearchThings(camera) will return both thing1 and thing2.
This action searches for exact matches and doesn't perform partial text matching.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the SearchThings service method.
member.returns: The response from the SearchThings service method, as returned by IoTThingsGraph.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for SearchThings Operation

This action searches for exact matches and doesn't perform partial text matching.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the SearchThings service method.

member.name: M:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.AmazonIoTThingsGraphClient.UploadEntityDefinitions(Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.UploadEntityDefinitionsRequest)
member.summary:
Asynchronously uploads one or more entity definitions to the user's namespace. The document parameter is required if syncWithPublicNamespace and deleteExistingEntites are false. If the syncWithPublicNamespace parameter is set to true, the user's namespace will synchronize with the latest version of the public namespace. If deprecateExistingEntities is set to true, all entities in the latest version will be deleted before the new DefinitionDocument is uploaded.
When a user uploads entity definitions for the first time, the service creates a new namespace for the user. The new namespace tracks the public namespace. Currently users can have only one namespace. The namespace version increments whenever a user uploads entity definitions that are backwards-incompatible and whenever a user sets the syncWithPublicNamespace parameter or the deprecateExistingEntities parameter to true.
The IDs for all of the entities should be in URN format. Each entity must be in the user's namespace. Users can't create entities in the public namespace, but entity definitions can refer to entities in the public namespace.
Valid entities are Device, DeviceModel, Service, Capability, State, Action, Event, Property, Mapping, Enum.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the UploadEntityDefinitions service method.
member.returns: The response from the UploadEntityDefinitions service method, as returned by IoTThingsGraph.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for UploadEntityDefinitions Operation

member.name: T:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.IAmazonIoTThingsGraph
member.summary:
Interface for accessing IoTThingsGraph
AWS IoT Things Graph
AWS IoT Things Graph provides an integrated set of tools that enable developers to connect devices and services that use different standards, such as units of measure and communication protocols. AWS IoT Things Graph makes it possible to build IoT applications with little to no code by connecting devices and services and defining how they interact at an abstract level.
For more information about how AWS IoT Things Graph works, see the User Guide.

member.name: M:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.IAmazonIoTThingsGraph.CreateSystemInstance(Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.CreateSystemInstanceRequest)
member.summary:
Creates a system instance.
This action validates the system instance, prepares the deployment-related resources. For Greengrass deployments, it updates the Greengrass group that is specified by the greengrassGroupName parameter. It also adds a file to the S3 bucket specified by the s3BucketName parameter. You need to call DeploySystemInstance after running this action.
For Greengrass deployments, since this action modifies and adds resources to a Greengrass group and an S3 bucket on the caller's behalf, the calling identity must have write permissions to both the specified Greengrass group and S3 bucket. Otherwise, the call will fail with an authorization error.
For cloud deployments, this action requires a flowActionsRoleArn value. This is an IAM role that has permissions to access AWS services, such as AWS Lambda and AWS IoT, that the flow uses when it executes.
If the definition document doesn't specify a version of the user's namespace, the latest version will be used by default.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateSystemInstance service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateSystemInstance service method, as returned by IoTThingsGraph.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateSystemInstance Operation

You need to call DeploySystemInstance after running this action.
For Greengrass deployments, since this action modifies and adds resources to a Greengrass group and an S3 bucket on the caller's behalf, the calling identity must have write permissions to both the specified Greengrass group and S3 bucket. Otherwise, the call will fail with an authorization error.

member.name: M:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.IAmazonIoTThingsGraph.DeploySystemInstance(Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.DeploySystemInstanceRequest)

summary.para: Deploys the system instance to the target specified in CreateSystemInstance.
If the system or any workflows and entities have been updated before this action is called, then the deployment will create a new Amazon Simple Storage Service resource file and then deploy it.

Since this action creates a Greengrass deployment on the caller's behalf, the calling identity must have write permissions to the specified Greengrass group. Otherwise, the call will fail with an authorization error.
For information about the artifacts that get added to your Greengrass core device when you use this API, see AWS IoT Things Graph and AWS IoT Greengrass.

member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DeploySystemInstance service method.
member.returns: The response from the DeploySystemInstance service method, as returned by IoTThingsGraph.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for DeploySystemInstance Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.IAmazonIoTThingsGraph.SearchThings(Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.SearchThingsRequest)
member.summary:
Searches for things associated with the specified entity. You can search by both device and device model.
For example, if two different devices, camera1 and camera2, implement the camera device model, the user can associate thing1 to camera1 and thing2 to camera2. SearchThings(camera2) will return only thing2, but SearchThings(camera) will return both thing1 and thing2.
This action searches for exact matches and doesn't perform partial text matching.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the SearchThings service method.
member.returns: The response from the SearchThings service method, as returned by IoTThingsGraph.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for SearchThings Operation

This action searches for exact matches and doesn't perform partial text matching.

member.name: M:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.IAmazonIoTThingsGraph.UpdateFlowTemplate(Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.UpdateFlowTemplateRequest)

member.name: M:Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.IAmazonIoTThingsGraph.UploadEntityDefinitions(Amazon.IoTThingsGraph.Model.UploadEntityDefinitionsRequest)
member.summary:
Asynchronously uploads one or more entity definitions to the user's namespace. The document parameter is required if syncWithPublicNamespace and deleteExistingEntites are false. If the syncWithPublicNamespace parameter is set to true, the user's namespace will synchronize with the latest version of the public namespace. If deprecateExistingEntities is set to true, all entities in the latest version will be deleted before the new DefinitionDocument is uploaded.
When a user uploads entity definitions for the first time, the service creates a new namespace for the user. The new namespace tracks the public namespace. Currently users can have only one namespace. The namespace version increments whenever a user uploads entity definitions that are backwards-incompatible and whenever a user sets the syncWithPublicNamespace parameter or the deprecateExistingEntities parameter to true.
The IDs for all of the entities should be in URN format. Each entity must be in the user's namespace. Users can't create entities in the public namespace, but entity definitions can refer to entities in the public namespace.
Valid entities are Device, DeviceModel, Service, Capability, State, Action, Event, Property, Mapping, Enum.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the UploadEntityDefinitions service method.
member.returns: The response from the UploadEntityDefinitions service method, as returned by IoTThingsGraph.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for UploadEntityDefinitions Operation
